definitions: feeling or showing severe mental or physical pain and emotional torment
characterized by or expressing deep anxiety, grief, or mental suffering
examples: Her anguished cries echoed through the hospital corridor
The mother made an anguished plea for her missing child
His anguished expression revealed the depth of his loss
The artist captured anguished faces in his war paintings

definitions: having one or more angles, corners, or sharp edges in shape
lean and having prominent bones with little flesh covering them
relating to or measured in terms of angles in geometry or physics
examples: The modern building features angular architecture with sharp edges
She arranged the angular pieces of the abstract sculpture
His angular face gave him a distinguished appearance
The model's angular cheekbones were accentuated by the lighting
The angular velocity of the spinning wheel increased steadily
They calculated the angular distance between the two stars

definitions: of, relating to, or characteristic of animals as living organisms
relating to the physical needs and activities rather than spiritual or intellectual ones
driven by basic instincts and lacking reason or self-control
examples: Animal welfare organizations protect endangered species worldwide
The laboratory studies animal behavior in natural habitats
He satisfied his animal appetites without restraint
Their relationship was based on animal attraction
The crowd's animal fury frightened the security guards
She fought with animal ferocity to protect her children

definitions: characteristic of or resembling the behavior, nature, or instincts of animals
displaying primitive, savage, or uncontrolled behavior lacking human refinement
examples: His animalistic grunts during the fight disturbed onlookers
The dancer's animalistic movements captivated the audience
The mob descended into animalistic violence and chaos
Their animalistic treatment of prisoners violated human rights

definitions: alive or having life, especially as distinguished from inanimate objects
full of life, activity, or movement; spirited and energetic
examples: Scientists debate whether viruses are animate or inanimate entities
The distinction between animate and inanimate matter puzzles philosophers
Her animate personality brightened every room she entered
The animate discussion continued well into the night

definitions: full of life, vigor, or spirit; lively and enthusiastic
made using the technique of animation in film or television
characterized by energetic and expressive gestures or manner of speaking
examples: The animated crowd cheered as the team scored
Her animated storytelling kept the children enthralled
The animated film won several Academy Awards this year
Children love watching animated cartoons on Saturday mornings
They had an animated debate about climate change policy
His animated gestures emphasized every point he made

definitions: giving life, vitality, or spirit to something or someone
serving as the motivating force or principle behind an action or belief
examples: The animating force of spring brought the garden to life
Music had an animating effect on the tired dancers
Freedom was the animating principle of their revolution
The animating spirit of democracy inspired the movement

definitions: of or relating to the belief that natural objects and phenomena have souls
examples: The animist traditions of the indigenous people honored forest spirits
Animist beliefs influenced their agricultural practices significantly

definitions: relating to or characterized by the belief that natural objects possess souls
examples: Their animistic worldview shaped their environmental conservation efforts
The tribe's animistic rituals honored the mountain spirits

definitions: having been completely destroyed or obliterated with nothing remaining
thoroughly defeated or beaten in competition or conflict
extremely drunk or under the influence of drugs to the point of incapacitation
examples: The annihilated city lay in ruins after the bombing
The hurricane left annihilated communities along the coast
The annihilated team lost by fifty points
Their annihilated army retreated in complete disorder
He got completely annihilated at the bachelor party
She was annihilated after drinking all night

definitions: causing complete destruction or obliteration of something
inflicting a crushing and total defeat upon an opponent
examples: The annihilating force of the explosion leveled the building
The annihilating power of nuclear weapons terrifies humanity
They delivered an annihilating blow to their competitors
The team's annihilating performance left opponents demoralized

definitions: having been publicly or formally declared or made known
already revealed or disclosed to others at an earlier time
examples: The announced merger surprised industry analysts yesterday
Their announced engagement delighted both families
The announced changes to the policy take effect Monday
She arrived at the previously announced time

definitions: feeling or experiencing mild anger, irritation, or displeasure
displaying or expressing irritation or impatience with someone or something
examples: She felt annoyed by the constant interruptions
The annoyed customer demanded to speak with a manager
His annoyed expression made his feelings perfectly clear
The teacher's annoyed tone silenced the chattering students

definitions: causing mild anger, irritation, or displeasure in others
persistently troublesome or causing repeated frustration and irritation
examples: The annoying buzzing of mosquitoes kept us awake
His annoying habit of interrupting frustrated everyone
That annoying song played constantly on the radio
The annoying delays made everyone miss their connections

definitions: happening, appearing, or performed once every year or yearly
covering or lasting for the period of a single year
calculated or determined on a yearly basis for measurement or payment
examples: The annual conference attracts thousands of participants
We look forward to our annual family reunion
The annual plants died after the first frost
She bought an annual subscription to the magazine
His annual salary exceeded six figures this year
The annual growth rate reached three percent

definitions: having the form of a ring or shaped like a ring
examples: The annular eclipse created a ring of fire around the moon
The tree's annular growth rings showed its age

definitions: deviating from what is standard, normal, or expected in nature or character
inconsistent with or contradicting established rules, methods, or expectations
examples: The anomalous test results puzzled the research team
Scientists investigated the anomalous weather patterns
Her anomalous behavior at the meeting raised concerns
The anomalous data point suggested an error

definitions: having an unknown or unacknowledged name or identity of the creator or participant
lacking distinctive characteristics or qualities that make something memorable
examples: The anonymous donor contributed millions to the hospital
She received an anonymous letter threatening legal action
The anonymous office buildings lined the street
He lived in an anonymous suburb outside the city

definitions: required or expected to explain one's actions to someone in authority
able to be answered or responded to with a solution or explanation
examples: The CEO is answerable to the board of directors
Politicians should be answerable to their constituents
That philosophical question is not easily answerable
The detective found the mystery answerable with enough evidence

definitions: engaged in the act of responding to questions or requests
functioning as or providing a response or solution to something
examples: The answering service handles calls after business hours
She spent hours answering emails from clients
His answering smile reassured her worried expression
The answering echo bounced off the canyon walls

definitions: showing or feeling active opposition, hostility, or unfriendliness toward someone
acting in opposition or working against each other in a way that prevents cooperation
examples: His antagonistic attitude made collaboration impossible
The antagonistic neighbors argued over the property line
The antagonistic relationship between the departments hindered progress
These antagonistic forces created tension in the organization

definitions: existing or occurring before a war, especially the American Civil War
examples: The antebellum mansion showcased Southern architectural style
Historians study antebellum society to understand the Civil War

definitions: existing, happening, or coming before in time or order
preceding in logic or serving as the basis for a conclusion
examples: The antecedent events led directly to the revolution
Scientists studied antecedent conditions before the earthquake
The antecedent clause determines the truth of the statement
In grammar, pronouns refer to their antecedent nouns

definitions: occurring or existing before birth, relating to pregnancy and prenatal care
examples: She attended antenatal classes to prepare for childbirth
The antenatal screening detected potential health issues early

definitions: situated at or toward the front of a body structure or organ
coming before in time or occurring earlier in a sequence
examples: The anterior chamber of the eye contains aqueous humor
Damage to the anterior ligament required immediate surgery
The anterior chapter provides necessary background information
These anterior events shaped the current situation

definitions: originating from or caused by human activity and its impact on nature
examples: Scientists study anthropogenic climate change and its effects
Anthropogenic pollution threatens marine ecosystems worldwide

definitions: relating to the scientific study of human beings and their cultures
examples: The anthropological research revealed ancient burial customs
She conducted anthropological fieldwork in remote villages

definitions: attributing human characteristics, emotions, or behaviors to non-human entities or things
examples: The anthropomorphic characters in the animated film delighted children
Ancient cultures created anthropomorphic representations of their gods

definitions: opposed to or against something or someone in attitude or action
examples: She's very anti the proposed development plans
The anti forces mobilized against the new legislation

definitions: designed or used for defense against attacking aircraft and aerial threats
examples: Antiaircraft guns protected the military base from aerial attacks
The ship's antiaircraft systems tracked incoming threats

definitions: capable of destroying or inhibiting the growth of bacteria and bacterial infections
examples: The antibacterial soap helps prevent the spread of germs
Doctors prescribed antibacterial medication for the infection

definitions: relating to or being a substance that kills or inhibits bacterial growth
examples: Antibiotic resistance poses a serious threat to public health
The doctor prescribed antibiotic treatment for the infection

definitions: characterized by playful, outrageous, or silly behavior meant to amuse
examples: His antic behavior at the party entertained everyone
The children's antic pranks drove their teacher crazy

definitions: used or effective against cancer cells or in cancer treatment
examples: Researchers developed new anticancer drugs for clinical trials
The anticancer properties of certain foods interest scientists

definitions: expected or predicted to happen based on prior knowledge or planning
looked forward to with eager expectation and excitement
examples: The anticipated rainfall never materialized yesterday afternoon
Production delays exceeded the anticipated timeframe
The anticipated sequel finally arrived in theaters
Her anticipated return home brought joy to everyone

definitions: characterized by or showing excitement or anxiety about something that will happen
done or occurring before an expected event in preparation
examples: Her anticipatory excitement grew as the wedding approached
The anticipatory anxiety before exams affected his sleep
They took anticipatory measures against the coming storm
The anticipatory breach of contract triggered legal action

definitions: moving in the opposite direction to the hands of a clock
examples: Turn the valve anticlockwise to open the water flow
The dancers moved anticlockwise around the maypole

definitions: capable of preventing or treating fungal infections and growth
examples: The doctor prescribed antifungal cream for the skin infection
Antifungal treatments cleared up the persistent condition

definitions: capable of destroying or inhibiting the growth of microorganisms like bacteria and fungi
examples: The antimicrobial coating on medical devices prevents infections
Scientists tested the antimicrobial properties of silver nanoparticles

definitions: relating to or dealing with antiques or the study of ancient objects
examples: The antiquarian bookshop specialized in rare first editions
His antiquarian interests led him to collect ancient coins

definitions: old-fashioned or outdated and no longer useful or relevant in modern times
examples: The company's antiquated computer system desperately needs upgrading
His antiquated views on gender roles offended many colleagues

definitions: belonging to or remaining from ancient times or a past era
having value because of considerable age and often collectible quality
examples: The antique furniture dated back to the eighteenth century
She wore an antique locket inherited from her grandmother
The antique vase sold for thousands at auction
Collectors searched estate sales for antique treasures

definitions: showing hostility, prejudice, or discrimination against Jewish people
examples: The antisemitic graffiti on the synagogue shocked the community
His antisemitic remarks led to immediate termination

definitions: preventing infection by inhibiting the growth of infectious agents
so clean and neat as to lack warmth, character, or interest
examples: The nurse applied antiseptic solution to the wound
Antiseptic wipes cleaned the medical instruments thoroughly
The antiseptic hospital room felt cold and unwelcoming
His antiseptic personality made forming friendships difficult

definitions: avoiding or not enjoying the company of others and social interaction
contrary to the laws and customs of society and causing harm
examples: His antisocial behavior worried his concerned parents
She became increasingly antisocial after the traumatic event
The gang's antisocial activities terrorized the neighborhood
Antisocial personality disorder requires professional treatment

definitions: designed or used for detecting and destroying enemy submarines
examples: The navy deployed antisubmarine warfare helicopters
Antisubmarine nets protected the harbor during wartime

definitions: designed to destroy or disable tanks and armored vehicles
examples: Soldiers carried antitank weapons during the urban combat
The antitank mines blocked the enemy's advance

definitions: directly opposed or contrasted in character, purpose, or meaning; mutually incompatible
examples: His actions were antithetical to his stated beliefs
The two philosophies are antithetical to each other

definitions: relating to legislation preventing monopolies and promoting business competition
examples: The company faced antitrust violations for price fixing
Antitrust laws protect consumers from corporate monopolies

definitions: acting against viruses or used to treat viral infections
examples: The doctor prescribed antiviral medication for the flu
Scientists developed new antiviral drugs during the pandemic
